issue.title: [R] Run "no libarrow" R build in the same CI entry if possible
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5590](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5590). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This build only takes 3min30sec, so I think it's OK to run it in the same CI entry if possible

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5590?focusedCommentId=16863339) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
On the other hand, if it only takes 3m30s to run, why bother moving it? I know we're throttled on executors but seems like this one will free up its executor quickly.

IMO this isn't worth the trouble as long as we're using Travis, but whenever we add more R builds to ursabot, and we're already having to reimplement the build steps, it makes sense to do then.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5590?focusedCommentId=16864903) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 4580
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4580>
